security: Disclosing that HIDALGO, Balmes, Jr. is a covert employee undergoing sensitive training in the US and the Agency's need to protect his identity could "jeopardize his future as a covert employee of this Agency."
summary: A memo regarding Balmes Hidalgo Jr., a covert employee of the Agency, who is in the U.S. for training and being considered for a sensitive assignment, addressing a request from the Immigration and Naturalization Service (INS) to potentially use him as an informant.
summary_one_paragraph: This memo, dated June 22, 1954, from the Chief of the Special Referral Branch to the Deputy Chief of SSD, concerns Balmes Hidalgo Jr., a covert CIA employee undergoing training in the United States. It discusses a request from the Immigration and Naturalization Service (INS) to utilize Hidalgo as an informant on Communist activities. The memo details internal discussions with WH/FT, WH/Panama, and Staff C/ICB, highlighting concerns that public testimony would compromise Hidalgo's future sensitive assignments and recommends that INS submit questions through the Agency to protect his covert status.
title: HIDALGO, Balmes, Jr. #65077
